KOSCIELNY: IT IS DIFFICULT TO WIN IF YOU DON’T SCORE

“I think in the final third we needed to keep more calm and not try to find the final ball and to continue to play with movement,” Koscielny told Sky Sports.

“In the second half we didn’t stop but conceded the goal early. We had some chances and we didn’t score. It is difficult to win if you don’t score. We need to keep our ambition and our game. We can come back.

“We needed to be clean with the ball and we weren’t. In football if you give a small chance to your opponent you pay and today we did.

“When you are arriving towards Christmas you know it is a big period and it is hard to compete at the same level.

“We started the new year with a win and we prepared for this game and came here with ambition for three points but we need to keep calm and focused on how we want to play.”

There’s a possibility that we could fall six points adrift of the top four if Chelsea beat Newcastle United this afternoon. We face the Blues next weekend knowing we’ll have to win if we’re to retain an outside chance of finishing in the Champions League places.

“It is a home game against an opponent in the top four,” noted Koscielny. “We know what we need to do. We need to prepare all week for this important team.”

replies.msg:
CARRASCO TO ENGLAND?

Yannick Carrasco is keen on a return to Europe just a year after leaving Atletico Madrid for Chinese side Dalian Yifang, with Arsenal and Manchester United potential destinations for the Belgium international.

Speaking on Belgian TV, Carrasco's wife Noemie Happert said Carrasco wants to be closer to family and friends.

"A lot of clubs are interested, nothing concrete, nothing has been signed yet," she said. Asked about the reports linking Carrasco with Arsenal and United, she continued: ‘Yes, they are very interested. I do not hide it, but nothing is signed.’

æ‰“è»Œå ´æ³¢å†å””å‡ºç‡’ä¸å¦‚çœŸä¿‚è³£å·¦ä½¢å•¦
å””å¥½å†å’æ¨£å°æˆ‘ç‡’

Arsenal legend believes the club have made a massive mistake in choosing Ozil over Ramsey

Former Arsenal defender Martin Keown believes the club have made a mistake by choosing to invest in Mesut Ozil rather than Aaron Ramsey.

“Listen I think he’s a wonderful player, he’s done a great job for Arsenal,” Keown said of Ramsey. “I’m really surprised [they’ve allowed him to leave].

"I think it goes back really to that decision, did they make the right one when they put all that money into [Mesut] Ozil, spending obviously a fortune, a massive commitment for the football club, what it’s costing and he’s not even playing.

“If you see what Ramsey can do. Incredible. He’s so professional, he’s unaffected, we saw him come on earlier in the season against Fulham — incredible buildup in that goal.

"I’m really surprised that he’s going to the likes of Juventus that just shows you the calibre, this is not an ordinary player, and the sort of player Arsenal should be trying to keep desperately at the club. I think they’ve made the wrong call.”

Arsenal legend believes the club have made a massive mistake in choosing Ozil over Ramsey

Former Arsenal defender Martin Keown believes the club have made a mistake by choosing to invest in Mesut Ozil rather than Aaron Ramsey.

“Listen I think he’s a wonderful player, he’s done a great job for Arsenal,” Keown said of Ramsey. “I’m really surprised [they’ve allowed him to leave].

"I think it goes back really to that decision, did they make the right one when they put all that money into [Mesut] Ozil, spending obviously a fortune, a massive commitment for the football club, what it’s costing and he’s not even playing.

“If you see what Ramsey can do. Incredible. He’s so professional, he’s unaffected, we saw him come on earlier in the season against Fulham — incredible buildup in that goal.

"I’m really surprised that he’s going to the likes of Juventus that just shows you the calibre, this is not an ordinary player, and the sort of player Arsenal should be trying to keep desperately at the club. I think they’ve made the wrong call.”

Arsenal legend believes the club have made a massive mistake in choosing Ozil over Ramsey

Former Arsenal defender Martin Keown believes the club have made a mistake by choosing to invest in Mesut Ozil rather than Aaron Ramsey.

“Listen I think he’s a wonderful player, he’s done a great job for Arsenal,” Keown said of Ramsey. “I’m really surprised [they’ve allowed him to leave].

"I think it goes back really to that decision, did they make the right one when they put all that money into [Mesut] Ozil, spending obviously a fortune, a massive commitment for the football club, what it’s costing and he’s not even playing.

“If you see what Ramsey can do. Incredible. He’s so professional, he’s unaffected, we saw him come on earlier in the season against Fulham — incredible buildup in that goal.

"I’m really surprised that he’s going to the likes of Juventus that just shows you the calibre, this is not an ordinary player, and the sort of player Arsenal should be trying to keep desperately at the club. I think they’ve made the wrong call.”

https://www.football.london/arsenal-fc/news/arsenal-legend-believes-club-made-15668599
